description: Borrowed from Middle French ferrier, from Old French ferrier, from Latin ferrarius, from ferrum (“iron”).

entries.meaning: A person who maintains the health and balance of horses' feet through the trimming of the hoof and fitting of horseshoes.

verbs.description: farrier (third-person singular simple present farriers, present participle farriering, simple past and past participle farriered)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To practise as a farrier; to carry on the trade of a farrier.
